Anyway, whenever Zed tries to run, have 1 person go for his shadow, and another someone go for him. It's the same strategy as chasing any mobile champion,  you don't all just right-click and hope your character catches up.

If you have your squishies stand further back from the front line, he'll have to get closer to make his shadows reach them, which means when he tries to disengage, the switch wont put nearly as much distance between you and him if he ults in and out.

B) I didn't know that you could buy Zhonya's before Zed hits level 6.

C) QSS works on Zed's ult but does nothing to the rest of his damage.

We are saying things that counter I dont see why champions cant be included.  Lissandra and Kayle are the deffinition of hard counters to zed.  Ahri doesnt have an extremely hard counter (atleast not one that i know of).  The point of qss is late game for adc's when zed goes in to kill you he cant stay the entire duration without dying unless he is crazy fed, he must back out and rely on his death marks activation (which qss completely nulifies).  Just because you wont have zhonyas at lvl 6 does not mean it doesnt 100% fuck zed in the ass.  All you need is armguard to survive his ult at lvl 6, after that you can rely on the safety of your zhonyas.  They all seem like valid counters to me.  And thank you for actually trying to argue instead of just down voting.  And Im also guessing you have nothing to say about how Phreak's statement was true?

A) Riot doesn't think that counterpicking someone qualifies as enough gameplay; see the Sona nerfs, where, despite having an obvious counter (Leona or any hard engage whatsoever) they claimed that it sucked too much fighting her when you weren't facing her counters.

B) Late game is generally not a problem for assassins, at least for me. My complaints lie in the early game, where they can get crazy fed because it's not like an ADC can pick up a casual QSS against an AD champion.

C) Because even if he blows his ult and you survive due to your armguard, it forces you to back, giving him more farm time compared to you.

D) Either use bullet points or paragraphs, because a wall of text is hard to read.

E) Thank you.

F) Ahri has several weaknesses; she's skillshot reliant (sure, W and R are autotarget but you can't kill someone with just those), she has mana problems (especially if she's spamming her Q) and she's weak whenever her ult isn't down. I don't think the nerfs were unjustified, but perhaps they were too harsh.

E - 50% AP scailing from 35%, damage amp removed
